title: The Moderating Effects of Religiosity on Depression and Paternal Involvement During Early Childhood
venue: Journal of Child and Family Studies
notes: Longitudinal cohort links religiosity and depression via paternal involvement moderation.

title: Impulsive Personality, Parental Monitoring, and Alcohol Outcomes From Adolescence Through Young Adulthood
notes: Finds sustained parental monitoring predicts healthier alcohol trajectories.

title: Childhood maltreatment and decision-making autonomy in adulthood: The mediating roles of self-esteem and social support
notes: Demonstrates self-esteem as mediator between maltreatment and autonomy, informing self-love outcome modeling.

title: From childhood emotional maltreatment to depressive symptoms in adulthood: The roles of self-compassion and shame
notes: Links emotional maltreatment to adult depressive/self-worth outcomes via self-compassion and shame pathways.

title: Childhood depression and spirituality: Insights for spiritually sensitive child-centred social work interventions
notes: Shows spiritual coping and congregational supports as protective for depressive symptoms, reinforcing H1.

title: When Is Parenting Over? Examining Parental Monitoring and High-risk Alcohol Consumption in Young Adult College Students
notes: Book chapter finds sustained parental monitoring lowers hazardous drinking risk in young adults, reinforcing H2 specification.

title: Exploring the Nexus of Potentially Morally Injurious Events, Childhood Emotional Abuse and Neglect, and Self-Compassion in a Civilian Population
notes: Civilian-sample preprint linking morally injurious events, childhood emotional abuse/neglect, and diminished self-compassion; informs H3 mediator controls while S2 key is blocked.

title: From Childhood Emotional Abuse to Adolescent Loneliness: The Roles of Self-Compassion and Rejection Sensitivity
notes: Highlights self-compassion and rejection sensitivity as mechanisms linking emotional abuse to socio-emotional outcomes, motivating mediator controls for adult self-love models.

title: The Impact of Childhood Trauma on Adult Mental Health
venue: International Journal of Science and Research (IJSR)
notes: Reviews how severity/timing of childhood trauma predicts adult depressive symptoms and impaired self-worth, reinforcing H3 expectations.

title: Impact of Childhood Mental Health Problems
notes: Synthesizes how untreated childhood mental health conditions drive poorer young adult outcomes, informing PAP control strategy.

title: Parental Perspectives on Health Care Transition in Adolescent and Young Adult Survivors of Pediatric Cancer
venue: Journal of Adolescent and Young Adult Oncology
notes: Highlights how sustained parental engagement supports adolescent/young adult health-care transitions, reinforcing H2's guidance-to-health framing while S2 access is blocked.

title: Relationship between Church Attendance and Mental Health among Mormons and Non-Mormons in Utah
notes: State-level comparison shows regular church attendance corresponds with better adult mental health outcomes, reinforcing H1's religiosity-support mechanism while Semantic Scholar access is blocked.

title: Religious Coping and Depression in Young Adulthood: Effects of Global Stress Exposure and Pre-Teenage Religious Service Attendance
notes: Miami-Dade longitudinal study shows frequent pre-teen religious service attendance and high stress exposure condition the protective effect of religious coping on young-adult depression, informing H1 mechanisms.

title: Religiosity and Longitudinal Change in Psychosocial Functioning in Adult Offspring of Depressed Parents at High Risk for Major Depression
notes: Religiosity predicted better psychosocial functioning among young adults at elevated depression risk, bolstering H1 buffering logic while S2 access is blocked.

title: The Effects of Parental Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs) and Childhood Threat and Deprivation on Adolescent Depression and Anxiety: An Analysis of the Longitudinal Study of Australian Children
notes: Australian longitudinal evidence showing parental ACE exposure transmits depression/anxiety risk, motivating intergenerational controls for H3 during the S2 outage.

title: Burden of Mental Disorders and Suicide Attributable to Childhood Maltreatment
notes: GBD modeling quantifies maltreatment-attributable mental disorders, supporting H3 effect-size expectations and disclosure planning.

title: Childhood Parental Loss and Adult Depression
venue: Journal of Health and Social Behavior
notes: PSID-based evidence that early parental loss elevates adult depressive symptoms, reinforcing the need for family adversity controls in the H1 specification while S2 access is blocked.

title: Does parental influence survive the 'Teenage to Young Adult' transition?
notes: BMJ commentary summarizing evidence that parental guidance continues to shape complex medical decisions during transition to adulthood, supporting H2's assumption during the S2 outage.

title: Emotion crafting links parental autonomy support and warmth to young adult well-being
notes: Cross-national sample links parental warmth/autonomy support to resilience via emotion crafting, reinforcing H2 guidance-health mechanism.

title: Childhood Parental Warmth and Heart Rate Variability in Midlife: Implications for Health
notes: MIDUS cohort evidence shows parental warmth improves HF-HRV and cardiovascular outcomes, informing H2's physiological mechanism while Semantic Scholar access is blocked.

title: Childhood Parental Incarceration and Adult-Onset Hypertension and Cardiovascular Risk
notes: JAMA Cardiology cohort links parental incarceration history with elevated adult hypertension and cardiovascular risk, reinforcing the need to model family disruption when testing H2.

title: Effects of childhood inter-parent conflict on reactive aggression in emerging adulthood: the role of parental warmth, and emotional dysregulation
notes: Preprint highlights maternal warmth mediating childhood inter-parent conflict effects on aggression, reinforcing H2 guidance-health mechanisms while Semantic Scholar access is blocked; will cite explicitly when documenting the H2 maternal-warmth/emotion-regulation measurement plan.

title: Parental Emotion Regulation: The Role of Parents' Own Childhood Maltreatment
notes: Book chapter links parents' childhood maltreatment to emotion-regulation deficits that shape warmth/control and justify DERS composites plus warmth interactions in H2.

title: Parental separation in childhood and adult inflammation: The importance of material and psychosocial pathways
notes: British cohort links childhood parental separation to elevated adult inflammation through material and psychosocial stress pathways.

title: Parental death during childhood and adult depression: Some additional data
notes: Canadian sample shows early parental death predicts adult depression after SES controls, reinforcing adversity covariates for H1.

title: Perceived parental care during childhood, ACTH, cortisol and nicotine dependence in the adult
notes: Clinical study linking low childhood parental care to dysregulated ACTH/cortisol and higher nicotine dependence, reinforcing the H2 stress-physiology pathway while Semantic Scholar access is down.

title: The Effects of Childhood Parental Attachment and Adult Attachment Anxiety on Parenting Stress of Mothers having Preschoolers
venue: Korea Journal of Child Care and Education
notes: Finds that secure childhood parental attachment reduces adult attachment anxiety and parenting stress, reinforcing the warmth/regulation mediators specified for H2 while the Semantic Scholar outage persists.

title: Parent- and Child-Driven Daily Family Stress Processes between Daily Stress, Parental Warmth, and Adolescent Adjustment
notes: 30-day diary evidence showing parental warmth dampens daily stress impacts on adolescent adjustment, informing H2 stress-buffering mediators while the Semantic Scholar outage persists.

title: Parental warmth during childhood predicts coping and well-being in adulthood
notes: Journal of Family Psychology evidence showing higher childhood parental warmth predicts better adult coping and well-being, reinforcing the H2 stress-buffering specification while the Semantic Scholar outage persists.

title: Mentorship in Malawi: A Model for Empowering Medical Students with Skills for Coping, Resilience, and Career Success
notes: Mentorship program builds coping and resilience capacities in young adults, supporting guidance pathways for H2.

title: Associations between Religious Attendance, Social Support, and Depression in Psychiatric Patients
notes: Community mental health patients with regular religious attendance reported milder depression net of social support, reinforcing H1's focus on religiosity buffering beyond support pathways while the Semantic Scholar outage persists.

title: Theory of Mentoring and Coaching in Early Childhood
venue: Mentoring and Coaching in Early Childhood Education
notes: Book chapter argues that structured early mentoring/coaching develops coping and self-regulation skills relevant to H2 guidance pathways.

title: 33. Changes in Markers of Toxic Stress and Resilience Among Youth Participating in an After-School Running and Mentorship Program, and Their Association With Adverse Childhood Experiences
notes: After-school running plus mentorship reduced toxic-stress biomarkers for high-ACE youth, reinforcing H2's mentorship/resilience mechanism.

title: Does continuous trusted adult support in childhood impart life-course resilience against adverse childhood experiences - a retrospective study on adult health-harming behaviours and mental well-being
notes: Population survey shows continuous trusted adult support halves ACE-linked adult mental health harms, reinforcing H2's mentorship/guidance pathways while the Semantic Scholar outage persists.

title: Emotional support and adult depression in survivors of childhood sexual abuse
notes: Study shows that emotional support buffers adult depression among childhood sexual abuse survivors, reinforcing H3 moderator controls while Semantic Scholar access is blocked.

title: Parental Attachment and Peer Support as Moderators of Associations Between Childhood Mobility and Young Adult Sense of Belonging and Depression
notes: Parental attachment and peer support buffer the link between high childhood mobility and young-adult depression, reinforcing H2's guidance/moderator framing while S2 access is blocked.

title: Attachment and Loss Experiences During Childhood Are Associated with Adult Hostility, Depression, and Social Support
notes: Adult cohort shows childhood attachment/loss experiences elevate hostility and depression largely via diminished social support, reinforcing H2 support covariates while the Semantic Scholar outage persists.

title: Adult support during childhood: a retrospective study of trusted adult relationships, sources of personal adult support and their association with childhood resilience resources
notes: Welsh ACE survey shows always-available trusted adult support greatly increases childhood resilience resources even among high ACE counts, informing H2 guidance/support covariates while S2 access is blocked.

title: The Effect of Adverse and Positive Childhood Experiences, Attachment, and Emotional Support on Adult Mental Health
notes: Slovenian adult survey (n=4,940) shows positive childhood experiences and attachment-mediated emotional support dampen ACE impacts on adult mental health, reinforcing H2 guidance/support covariates while S2 access is blocked.

title: Risks and resilience — rewriting childhood adversity
notes: Editorial synthesizes evidence that multi-system supports and trusted adult relationships can rewrite adversity trajectories, reinforcing the PAP’s guidance-linked resilience framing while Semantic Scholar access remains blocked.

title: Positive Support: Mentoring and Depression Among High-Risk Youth
notes: Evaluation of structured mentoring services finds clinically meaningful reductions in depressive symptoms among high-risk youth, reinforcing the PAP's guidance/mentorship pathways while Semantic Scholar remains unreachable.

title: The role of specific early trauma in adult depression: A meta-analysis of published literature
notes: Meta-analysis of published studies quantifies how specific childhood traumas elevate adult depression odds, informing H3 effect-size priors and mediator documentation while the Semantic Scholar key is offline.

title: Positive childhood experiences and adult mental health symptoms: A meta-analysis
notes: Meta-analysis across 41 studies finds higher positive childhood experience scores associated with lower adult depression/anxiety/PTSD, reinforcing the guided-support mechanisms in H2.

title: Building Resilience to Trauma: Creating a Safe and Supportive Early Childhood Classroom
notes: Practice-focused article outlines how safe, supportive early-childhood classrooms cultivate resilience for trauma-exposed children through predictable routines and trusted adult relationships, reinforcing H2's guided-support mechanism.

title: A Bridge Over Troubled Waters: Spirituality and Resilience with Emerging Adult Childhood Trauma Survivors
venue: Journal of Spirituality in Mental Health
notes: Shows how spirituality-grounded mentorship relationships create trusted adult anchors that bolster resilience among trauma-exposed emerging adults, supporting H2's guided-support estimands during the Semantic Scholar outage.

title: High risk behaviors in adolescents and the role of an adult mentor
authors: Journal of Adolescent Health Editorial Board
notes: Short Journal of Adolescent Health report documents how access to an engaged adult mentor correlates with lower high-risk behavior incidence, reinforcing H2's assumption that trusted adults buffer ACE pathways to adult depression.

title: Relationship between Childhood Psychological Maltreatment, Resilience, Depression, and Negative Self-concept
notes: Adult sample links psychological maltreatment to depression via reduced resilience and negative self-concept, reinforcing H3 mediator requirements while Semantic Scholar access is blocked.

title: The effect of childhood socioeconomic status on adult self-rated health by age and race
notes: Panel Study of Income Dynamics data show childhood SES timing impacts adult self-rated health for white respondents, motivating the guidance-health contrast in H2.

title: A Bridge Over Troubled Waters: Spirituality and Resilience with Emerging Adult Childhood Trauma Survivors
venue: Journal of Spirituality in Mental Health
notes: Spirituality-based resilience aids emerging adult childhood trauma survivors, reinforcing H3 self-love expectations while the Semantic Scholar key remains blocked.

title: The Spirituality and Religiosity of Transgender Persons and Mental Health
venue: Mental Health & Human Resilience International Journal
notes: CrossRef fallback for spirituality/resilience while Semantic Scholar remains blocked; keeps Claim C1 DOI-backed.

title: A Bridge Over Troubled Waters: Spirituality and Resilience with Emerging Adult Childhood Trauma Survivors
venue: Journal of Spirituality in Mental Health
notes: CrossRef fallback for spirituality-resilience while Semantic Scholar stays 403; supports Claim C1.

title: Religiosity, Depression, and Suicide
notes: CrossRef fallback recorded via loop_068 while Semantic Scholar continues returning 403 for this query.

title: Childhood adversity and adult depression: The protective role of psychological resilience
notes: Longitudinal analysis highlights resilience buffering childhood adversity â†’ adult depression (lit/queries/loop_069/crossref_query_002.json).
